From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To change the command history buffer size for a particular line, use the **history size** command in line configuration mode. To reset the command history buffer size to ten lines, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: Specifies the number of command lines that the system will record in its history buffer. The range is from 0 to 256. The default is 10.

Examples: The following example displays line 4 configured with a history buffer size of 35 lines:
ExtraInfo: The **history size** command should be used in conjunction with the **history** and **show history** commands. The **history** command enables or disables the command history function. The **show history** command lists the commands you have entered in the current EXEC session. The number of commands that the history buffer will show is set by the **history size** command.![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/note.gif)---**Note** ![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)The **history size** command only sets the size of the buffer; it does not reenable the history function. If the **no****history** command is used, the **history** command must be used to reenable this function.---
